page.title: 12ECOLOGY-BRYNGWYN POOL
page.content: Bryngwyn pool is in C2 kilometre square.It is the biggest pool in the grid.It measures 350 metres long and 70 metres wide approximately.The pool is in the grounds of Bryngwyn Hall which has been empty since the Second World War.In it's lonely setting a heronry has been established there for many years.The herons use the pool for nesting and roosting.The herons go fishing in the Rivers Cain,Vyrnwy and Banwy. They have five blue eggs which hatch in about three and a half weeks.They use the same nest nearly every time.Some of the trees surrounding the pool are dying possibly due to the build up of droppings.
